intro: Orychophragmus violaceus, commonly known as the violet hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a bluish-green hue. Its flowers are usually purple or violet, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Orychophragmus violaceus is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soil.
